controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class that runs the game and handles logic for user interaction
    Author:
    Matthew

      • handleMouseRelease

        public void handleMouseRelease(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Checks if the move was valid, if so, moves the piece to that spot, clears the old one. Otherwise, board is returned to it's state before the move was attempted
        Parameters:

        move -

      • handleEnPassantCaptures

        public Piece handleEnPassantCaptures(Move move)
        If execution gets to this method, then Move parameter move is valid. Check if it was an en passant capture. If it is a valid en passant capture, then we can clear the square that the previous move ended on, because it had to have been where the captured pawn ended up. Returns a reference to the pawn that got captured, if one exists
        Parameters:
        move -

      • removePieceFromList

        public void removePieceFromList(Move move)
        Removes the piece on the destination square of Move parameter move from it's black/white piece list in the model. Note: This method gets called eventually when checking to see how many moves a player has form a given position. If the player can check their opponent, then capturing the enemy king is a legal move from that position (even though it is not that player's turn). The end result is that the king might get "captured" by this method, but it's not because it's possible, the engine is just seeing if that is a legal move from the position (assuming it were able to move).
        Parameters:
        move -
